column4: Hi, my machine first turned off the monitor, and the caps lock, num lock, and scroll lock were all blinking. After restarting, the auto logon appears to function, but it only shows me an empty desktop.
I then ran tail /var/log/syslog , and it returned "GLib-GObject-CRITICAL: g_value_get_boolean: assertion `G_VALUE_HOLDS_BOOLEAN (value)' failed" . Can someone help please.
ctrl-alt-f1 to get to a console. then you can try to service gdm restart
It said "Rejected send message..."
sudo service gdm restart

So it appears ot have done the same as before. It plays the sound, displays the background, and the 'waiting' icon for the mouse. Then it displays the mouse icon on top of the background - no more, and no less.
some core desktop process is failing
Anything specific you could recommend short of a full reinstall?
I am using Ubuntu classic instead of unity.
a reinstall certainly isn't needed you. either update the software, or clear out the existing config for gnome
I should have the newest version of everything. How can I clear the config?
mv $HOME/.config $HOME/old_config
There is no old_config in my $home dir.
I looked with ls -a
mv .config old_config
My bad. I was looking at it like asm. DEST, SRC , not the other way around.
Same issue though after the rename.
I ran 'sudo service gdm restart', after renaming the .config file, and still, the same issue
It seems gnome-panel had been removed. Reinstalling meanwhile
(So sayeth syslog, anyways)
Woohoo! replacing config + reinstalling gnome-panel appears to have fixed it.
no problem
